?????


If one assert fails, the whole thing is invalid.
Fix what is broken, and run it again.
Everything should pass.

If you are check to make sure something is false but
are using assertTrue, then just do assertTrue(value ==
false).

-Eric


--- "Hoepner, Josh (J.M.)" <jhoepner@...> wrote:
> Hello all,
> 
> I am fairly new to JUnit and I have come across a
> problem while writing test cases.  I am in a
> situation where I require one test case to have
> multiple assertions.  If one of these assertions
> fails, I still need the others to run.  I'm sure
> someone else has tried something like this in the
> past, does anyone have any suggestions?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Josh Hoepner
> Great Lakes Technologies Group
>
